data.meta_description:
JERRY LEE LEWIS: TROUBLE IN MIND
Q&A with Director Ethan Coen and Editor Tricia Cooke
Wednesday, January 10 at 7:30
data.text:
With his brother Joel, Ethan Coen has been making movies for many years, among them, NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN, A SERIOUS MAN, THE BIG LEBOWSKI, BARTON FINK, FARGO, and THE LADYKILLERS. He has also written plays, radio plays, stories and poems. JERRY LEE LEWIS: TROUBLE IN MIND is his first documentary.

Tricia Cooke has edited films for many directors including three for and with Joel and Ethan Coen. Before JERRY LEE LEWIS: TROUBLE IN MIND she made one other documentary, WHERE THE GIRLS ARE, about the lesbian-mecca Dinah Shore golf tournament in Palm Springs. With Ethan Coen she wrote, produced, and directed DRIVE-AWAY DOLLS, coming out February 2024.

Supported by a Humanities New York Action Grant
